item.title: From http.server with love
item.description: Darling Moneypenny, you know I never even look at another woman.. -James Bond So we layed out the plan here, and now we action it. Let’s just jump right into it Here’s what we’re working with: $ tree . ├── Dockerfile ├── README.md └── src ├── httpsrv.py └── index.html Obviously the fun bits are going to be in httpsrv.py: from http.server import HTTPServer, BaseHTTPRequestHandler listenPort = 9292 class MyServer(BaseHTTPRequestHandler): def do_GET(self): if self.

item.title: httPyze - a Python model for secretProject
item.description: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it. -Confucius Python how I love thee, let me count the ways In a recent social engagement, the topic of discussion was Python. Somewhere in the middle of the conversation I said something along the lines of “I love Python, been reading it for years, wish I could write more of it everyday”. Then it dawned on me, why don’t I write Python everyday?
